thread.title: Dodgers, free agent Sergio Romo agree to deal | MLB.com
thread.title_full: Dodgers, free agent Sergio Romo agree to deal | MLB.com

author: Ken Gurnick
title: Dodgers, free agent Sergio Romo agree to deal | MLB.com
text:
Dodgers agree to deal with setup man Romo Romo seals the shutout 0:30 Sergio Romo strikes out Corey Seager swinging for the final out of the game, earning his fourth save and securing the Giants' 3-0 win By Ken Gurnick / MLB.com | @kengurnick | + 0 COMMENTS 
LOS ANGELES -- The Dodgers have agreed to a contract with former Giants reliever Sergio Romo , according to MLB.com's Jon Paul Morosi. 
The club has not confirmed the signing, which MLB.com's Jesse Sanchez reports is for one year and is pending a physical examination. Romo was the Giants' primary closer in 2013 and '14, when he recorded a combined 61 saves. He pitched well in a setup role in '15 and '16, compiling a 2.64 ERA last season, while limited to 40 appearances because of a forearm flexor strain. 
Romo, who turns 34 next month, would seem to have the inside track to replace setup man Joe Blanton , who also is a free agent. The slider specialist has more late-inning experience than Pedro Baez , Josh Ravin and Chris Hatcher , the right-handed trio figured to vie for the job had there not been a late acquisition. Source: Sergio Romo has agreed to a one-year deal with the #Dodgers as reported by @jonmorosi and @Ken_Rosenthal . Deal is pending physical. pic.twitter.com/CmTMXf5MwM â€” Jesse Sanchez (@JesseSanchezMLB) February 4, 2017 
At last weekend's FanFest, president of baseball operations Andrew Friedman indicated he was still looking to bolster the bullpen, one of the club's strengths last year, and said there were several intriguing free agents still on the market. 
The Dodgers had been rumored to also be interested in Blanton and Jerry Blevins . 
Romo is the second significant addition of the offseason, following the trade for second baseman and leadoff hitter Logan Forsythe from Tampa Bay for starting pitcher Jose De Leon . He also is the second former Giants closer the Dodgers have signed in recent years, following Brian Wilson. Ken Gurnick has covered the Dodgers since 1989, and for MLB.com since 2001. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs. Share This
